questions.question: What is the purpose of a router in a network?
questions.option_a: A. Connects multiple networks and forwards packets between them.
questions.option_b: B. Connects multiple devices on the same network.
questions.option_c: C. Provides a wireless connection for devices.
questions.option_d: D. Protects the network from cyber threats.
questions.explanation: A router is a networking device that forwards data packets between computer networks. Routers perform the traffic directing functions on the Internet.

questions.question: What does the acronym 'OSI' stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: OSI stands for Open System Interconnection. It is a conceptual model that standardizes the functions of a communication system into seven categories called layers.

questions.question: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for end-to-end transmission of data?
questions.explanation: The Transport Layer of the OSI model is responsible for end-to-end transmission of data. It provides reliable, transparent transfer of data between end systems.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the Network Layer in the OSI model?
questions.option_d: D. Establishing, managing and terminating connections
questions.explanation: The primary function of the Network Layer in the OSI model is data routing. It determines the best path for data transfer between networks.

questions.question: What does the acronym 'TCP' stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol. It is one of the main protocols in the Internet protocol suite, providing reliable, ordered and error-checked delivery of data.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a subnet mask in IP addressing?
questions.option_a: A. It identifies the network portion of an IP address.
questions.option_b: B. It hides the IP address from other devices on the network.
questions.option_c: C. It encrypts the IP address for security purposes.
questions.option_d: D. It converts the IP address into a binary format.
questions.explanation: A subnet mask is used in IP addressing to identify the network portion of an IP address. It separates the network ID from the host ID.

questions.question: What is the default subnet mask for a Class C IP address?
questions.explanation: The default subnet mask for a Class C IP address is 255.255.255.0.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to assign IP addresses to devices on a network?
questions.explanation: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) is used to dynamically assign IP addresses to devices on a network.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a firewall in a network?
questions.option_b: B. To assign IP addresses to devices
questions.option_c: C. To protect the network from unauthorized access
questions.option_d: D. To manage the network's bandwidth usage
questions.explanation: A firewall is a network security device that monitors incoming and outgoing network traffic and decides whether to allow or block specific traffic based on a defined set of security rules.

questions.question: What does the acronym 'VLAN' stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: VLAN stands for Virtual Local Area Network. It is a network of devices that appear to be on the same network even if they are on different physical segments of the LAN.
